cl.clayster.exi

Class EXIXMPPConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jivesoftware.smack.Connection
      • org.jivesoftware.smack.XMPPConnection
        • cl.clayster.exi.EXIXMPPConnection

  • public class EXIXMPPConnection
extends org.jivesoftware.smack.XMPPConnection
    Defines necessary methods to establish an EXI connection over XMPP as specified in XEP-0322.
    Author:
    Javier Placencio

    • Constructor Detail

      • EXIXMPPConnection

        public EXIXMPPConnection(org.jivesoftware.smack.ConnectionConfiguration config,
                 EXISetupConfiguration exiConfig)
        This constructor uses the given EXISetupConfiguration to negotiate EXI compression while logging in. By default, compression will be enabled unless exiConfig is null. All schemas within the schema folder will be used.
        Parameters:
        config - configurations to connect to the server
        exiConfig - EXI parameters to be used. If null, default EXI/XMPP parameters will be used.

    • Method Detail

      • setUploadSchemaOption

        public void setUploadSchemaOption(int option)
        Sets an option to decide what to do when there are missing schemas on the server. By default, those missing schemas will not be used. Other options are:
      • 0 - upload missing schemas as binary files
      • 0 - upload missing schemas as an EXI Document
      • 0 - upload missing schemas as an EXI Body
      • 0 - upload missing schemas' URL for the server to download them (if available)
Parameters:
option - the selected uploading option. They can be statically accessed through EXIXMPPConnection

  • proposeEXICompressionQuickSetup

    public boolean proposeEXICompressionQuickSetup()
    Uses quick configurations setup in order to skip the handshake. Only if the configured setup already has been used and exists.
    Returns:
    true if there is a previous configuration available, false otherwise

  • proposeEXICompression

    public boolean proposeEXICompression()
    Sends an EXI setup proposition to the server (is called only if the compression is supported)

  • requestEXICompression

    public void requestEXICompression(java.lang.String configId)
    Requests EXI compression to the server
    Parameters:
    configId - the current EXISetupConfiguration's ID

  • sendMissingSchemas

    public void sendMissingSchemas(java.util.List<java.lang.String> missingSchemas)
                        throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                               java.io.IOException,
                               org.dom4j.DocumentException,
                               com.siemens.ct.exi.exceptions.EXIException,
                               org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                               javax.xml.transform.TransformerException,
                               javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException
    Send schemas that are missing in the server. Then waits one second and retries configuration with a new stanza.
    Parameters:
    missingSchemas - a list containing all schemas missing in the server
    opt - how missing schemas will be sent to the server. Options are as follows
    0 - upload schema as a binary file
    1 - upload schema as EXI document
    2 - upload schema as EXI body
    3 - send a url for the server to download the schema by itself
    -1 - create a new canonical schema ignoring missing schemas (default)
    Throws:
    javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
    org.xml.sax.SAXException
    com.siemens.ct.exi.exceptions.EXIException
    org.dom4j.DocumentException
    java.io.IOException
    java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
    javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException

  • setCanonicalSchema

    public void setCanonicalSchema()
    Creates a canonical schema and adds its schema ID to the current connection's EXISetupConfiguration. The new canonical schema excludes missing schemas if existent.

  • isUsingCompression

    public boolean isUsingCompression()
    Description copied from class: org.jivesoftware.smack.Connection
    Returns true if network traffic is being compressed. When using stream compression network traffic can be reduced up to 90%. Therefore, stream compression is ideal when using a slow speed network connection. However, the server will need to use more CPU time in order to un/compress network data so under high load the server performance might be affected.
    Overrides:
    isUsingCompression in class org.jivesoftware.smack.XMPPConnection
    Returns:
    true if network traffic is being compressed.

  • schemaDownloaded

    public int schemaDownloaded()
    Used to reduce and get the count of schemas being downloaded on the server.
    Returns:
    Amount of schemas left to be downloaded. When 0 is returned, then the server has downloaded all schemas.
